    • Constructor Detail

      • SwitchBoxWidget

        public SwitchBoxWidget(int x,
                       int y,
                       int width,
                       int height,
                       boolean border,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> options,
                       java.lang.String initialOption,
                       java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> isValidOption,
                       java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> setOption)
        Creates a switchbox widget. A switchbox is a generalised checkbox, that rotates between a set of options.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of top-left corner
        y - y-coordinate of top-left corner
        width - width of switchbox
        height - height of switchbox
        border - whether to draw a border
        options - possible options for the switchbox
        initialOption - initial option, needs to be an element of options
        isValidOption - function, determines if the current option is valid
        setOption - function, fires when legal option is set

      • SwitchBoxWidget

        public SwitchBoxWidget(boolean border,

        Sets the currently displayed option.

        public boolean isBlocking()
        Description copied from class: Widget
        Returns whether the widget is blocking. If a widget blocks, no new mouse events get handled.

      • handleMouseEvent

        public boolean handleMouseEvent(int id,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                int clickCount)
        Description copied from class: Widget
        Event handler for mouse events
        Overrides:
        handleMouseEvent in class Widget
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the type of event. Can be MouseEvent.MOUSE_PRESSED, MouseEvent.MOUSE_RELEASED or MouseEvent.MOUSE_DRAGGED
        x - x-coordinate of mouse event
        y - y-coordinate of mouse event
        clickCount - amount of times clicked (e.g. 1 for normal press, 2 for double-click, ...)
